Posts.Content: I too am in the process of losing my hair for the second time and it doesn't get any easier in my case.  I so wish I could embrace the bald head but hate looking at my wrinkled unrecognizable self in the mirror.  I want to shave it now as it so thin but need my hairdresser to trim wig and she on holiday.  As yet my eyelashes and brows still in tact and I so hope they stay.  I have a wig, cap with hair hanging and the obligatory caps for sleeping.  As you say the plus side is no more shaving legs etc for a while.    I so admire the brave people who dare to bare.  Wish I was brave. Xxxx

Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Elmea cream.  Nubs the area. I have severe needle phobia.  Now have poracath for chemo use Elmea cream and don' feel a thing. X
Posts.Title: Scared of needles

Posts.Content: Yes it really does work.   I am having weekly chemo and bloods and I still get nervous until needle is in but can honestly say I can' feel it with the cream.   I don' know why I didn' have it last time I went through chemo.  A blob of cream has saved me so much distress and I wonder why it not available for anyone with a needle phobia.  Apparently it costs pence.  Hope you can get some.   I tried diazepam but it never helped.  The cream definitely does help.  Good Luck. Xx
